message.content: The generated code currently stores the user data in memory, which means all data will be lost when the server is restarted. A better approach would be to store the user data in a database. This would allow the data to persist across server restarts and also enable more complex queries.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code has added a database to persist user data, which is a great improvement. However, the password is currently stored as plain text in the database. This is a major security risk. A suggestion to improve this would be to hash the password before storing it in the database. This way, even if someone gains access to the database, they won't be able to see the actual passwords.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The generated code has improved security by hashing the passwords before storing them in the database. However, the current code does not handle the case where a user tries to register with an email that is already in use. A suggestion to improve this would be to add a check in the register function to see if the email is already in use, and if so, return an appropriate error message.
